link.name: 01_introduction
link.digest: A general introduction to FrameLib and some foundation DSP concepts..

li.link: Tutorial 1: An introduction to FrameLib and frame based processing.

link.name: 02_whatis
link.digest: Getting familiar with the FrameLib library.

li.link: Tutorial 2: An introduction to FrameLib and frame based processing.

link.name: 03_fl_concepts
link.digest: An overview and explanation of the key concepts of FrameLib, such as its timing and patching architecture.

link.name: 04_fl_conversion
link.digest: Methods for converting data between the Max and FrameLib domains.

li.link: Tutorial 4: Converting data between FrameLib and Max.

link.name: 05_fl_generators
link.digest: An overview of the various 'generator' objects belonging to the FrameLib eco-system.

link.name: 06_fl_firstproject
link.digest: A longer tutorial than the previous four that builds on previously covered information. Construct a granular synthesis engine from scratch and add increasingly complex features.

li.link: Tutorial 6: Your first FrameLib project - Building a granulator from scratch.

link.name: 07_fl_fft
link.digest: The Basics of FFT/STFT processing in FrameLib

link.name: 08_fl_multistream
link.digest: A feature unique to FrameLib and somewhat similar to the Max 'mc' system, multi-streaming allows you to manipulate multiple streams of data at varying rates and sizes with only one set of processing objects.

link.name: 09_fl_multiresfft
link.digest: An extension of the FFT tutorial, this crash course introduces you to the possibilities of multi-resolution FFT's.
